tuv.seg: Local authorities conduct much of their business at meetings of the full council
Is ag cruinnithe den chomhairle uile a dhéanann na húdaráis áitiúla mórchuid dá ngnó a reáchtáil
These meetings are regulated by law
Bíonn na cruinnithe seo faoi réir ag reachtaíocht dlíthiúil

(In other words, there are specific legal rules about how often the meetings should take place and how they are conducted, set out in Part 6 and Schedule 10 of the Local Government Act, 2001 and associated regulations - S.I. No

(Is é sin le rá go bhfuil sainrialacha dlíthiúla maidir le minicíocht na gcruinnithe agus modh oibre na gcruinnithe ar fáil i gCuid 6, agus Sceideal 10 den Acht Rialtais Áitiúil, 2001 agus sna rialacha gaolmhara -I.R.Uimh
There are essentially four different types of meetings held by the local authority:
Tá, go bunúsach, ceithre chineál cruinniú ar leith a reáchtálann an rialtas áitiúil:
• An annual meeting (held in May/June each year)
• Cruinniú cinn bliana (a reáchtáiltear i Mí Bealtaine /Meitheamh gach bliain)
• Ordinary meetings (usually held at least monthly)
• Gnáthchruinnithe (a reáchtáiltear go míosúil de ghnáth)
• A budget meeting (usually towards the end of the year)
• Cruinniú buiséid (a reáchtáiltear i dtreo dheireadh na bliana de ghnáth)
• A special meeting (held occasionally)
• Cruinniú speisialta (a reáchtáiltear ó am go ham)
Special meetings may also be called by the Cathaoirleach or by 5 members of the Council
Is féidir leis an gCathaoirleach nó le cúigear ball den Chomhairle cruinniú a ghlaoch
At the annual meeting (held in May/June each year), the Cathaoirleach is elected by the members
Ag an gcruinniú cinn bliana (a glaoitear i Mí Bealtaine/Meitheamh gach bliain), déanann na baill an Cathaoirleach a thoghadh
Following a local election, the first meeting of the local authority after the election is the annual meeting)
I ndiaidh toghchán áitiúil, is ionann an cruinniú cinn bliana agus an chéad chruinniú i ndiaidh an toghcháin)
Under Section 57 of the Local Authority Reform Act 2014, it is normally held on the fourteenth (14th) day after polling day
Faoi Alt 57 den Acht um Athchóiriú an Údaráis Áitiúil 2014, de ghnáth reáchtáiltear é ar an gceathrú lá déag (14ú) tar éis lá na votála
It is at this annual meeting that the various elected members are appointed to various committees of the local authority, in addition to other organisations
Is ag an gcruinniú cinn bliana seo a dhéantar na baill tofa éagsúla a cheapadh ar choistí éagsúla den údarás áitiúil, agus ar eagraíochtaí eile
Under the 2014 Act, the meeting also sets the days for the first meetings of the municipal district members for each of the municipal districts within the local authority's area
Faoin Acht 2014, leagann an gcruinniú seo freisin an lá don chéad chruinnithe de na comhaltaí ceantair chathrach do gach ceann de na ceantair chathrach laistigh de cheantar an údaráis áitiúil
They must take place within 10 days of the annual meeting
Ní mór dóibh tarlú laistigh de 10 lá ón gcruinniú bliantúil
The Cathaoirleach chairs the meetings of the council
Rialaíonn an Cathaoirleach cruinnithe de chuid na Comhairle
He or she is entitled to move that a councillor leave the meeting because of his/her conduct
Bíonn sé de cheart aige nó aici tairiscint a mholadh go bhfágfaidh Comhairleoir an cruinniú mar gheall ar a m(h)í-iompar
If that motion is seconded, the councillor must leave
Má chuidítear leis an tairiscint, bíonn ar an gComhairleoir imeacht
The Cathaoirleach also has the power to adjourn the meeting due to general disorder or because a person asked to leave has refused to do so
Tá an chumhacht freisin ag an gCathaoirleach an cruinniú a chur ar athló i ngeall ar mhí-ord ginearálta nó má dhiúltaíonn duine an cruinniú a fhágáil tar éis iarraidh air/uirthi imeacht
If it is practical, the authority should hold the meetings at the main offices of the council and should decide on and follow a regular schedule for the holding of ordinary meetings
Má tá sé praiticiúil, ba chóir don údarás na cruinnithe a reáchtáil i bpríomhoifigí na Comhairle agus ba chóir socrú a dhéanamh do sceideal rialta gnáthchruinnithe agus cloí leis seo
Section 45 of the Local Government Act, 2001 gives the public and the press a general right to be present at local authority meetings
Tugann Rannóg 45 den Acht Rialtais Áitiúil, 2001 gnáthcheart don phobal agus don phreas freastal ar chruinnithe den rialtas áitiúil
However, if the council has a special reason for doing so, it can decide by a resolution of at least 50% of its total members to hold the meeting in a private committee
Má tá cúis ar leith ag an gComhairle, áfach, is féidir an cruinniú a reáchtáil go príobháideach, má thacaíonn ar a laghad 50% de na baill uile lena leithéid de rún
It must be in the overall public interest to hold the meeting in private
Ní mór dó a bheith ar mhaithe le leas an phobail an cruinniú a reáchtáil go príobháideach
The public is entitled to 3 days notice of council meetings - the notice must be available for inspection at the main offices of the council
Tá sé de cheart ag an bpobal fógra trí lá a fháil do chruinnithe Comhairle - ní mór fáil a bheith go hoscailte ar an bhfógra i bpríomhoifigí na Comhairle
A local authority is entitled to make rules regulating the right of the public and the press to attend its meetings
Tá sé de cheart ag an rialtas áitiúil rialacha a chur i bhfeidhm maidir le ceart an phobail agus an phreasa freastal ar a chruinnithe

For example, it can limit the numbers of the public that can attend to take into account available space at the meeting, it can limit the taking of photographs and it can provide for removing members of the public who do not conduct themselves properly at the meeting

Is féidir, mar shampla, srian a chur ar líon na ndaoine ar féidir leo freastal de réir an spáis a bhíonn ar fáil, nó srian a chur ar ghriangrafanna a thógáil, agus is féidir socruithe a chur i bhfeidhm chun daoine a chur amach as an gcruinniú muna mbíonn siad á n-iompar féin mar is cóir
Every local authority will fix a minimum number of members (known as a 'quorum') that must be present in order for a meeting to commence and for business to be conducted
Aontóidh gach rialtas áitiúil ar an íosmhéid ball (ar a dtugtar 'quorum') is gá a bheith i láthair chun cruinniú a thosú agus chun gnó a reáchtáil
The quorum is 25% of the total number of members of the local authority plus one
Is ionann an quorum agus 25% móide a haon de líon iomlán na mball atá ar an údarás áitiúil
Where 25% of the total number of members is not a whole number, the quorum is the next highest whole number plus one
Mura slánuimhir í an 25% cuid den iomlán, is ionann an quorum agus an chéad slánuimhir eile móide a haon
In situations where a meeting is abandoned owing to failure to obtain a quorum, the names of those members present are recorded
Má chuirtear cruinniú ar ceal toisc nach bhfuil quorum ann, déantar na hainmneacha de na baill atá i láthair a liostáil
At the council meeting, every member of the council is entitled to vote for or against resolutions put forward at the meeting
Ag cruinniú na Comhairle, tá sé de cheart ag gach ball den Chomhairle vótáil i bhfábhar nó i gcoinne rún atá molta ag an gcruinniú
In most cases, a resolution is passed where the majority of the members present vote in favour of the resolution
I formhór na gcásanna, glactar le rún nuair a vótálann tromlach na mball atá i láthair i bhfábhar an rúin
